head.title: Beds, Baths And by Golly: 3 Stores Arrive

hedline.hl1: Beds, Baths And by Golly: 3 Stores Arrive

abstract.p: Manhattan is getting three home furnishings stores, Interieurs, Waterworks and Room; photos (S)

block.p: Over one month, three home furnishings stores -- Interieurs, Waterworks and Room -- will have opened in Manhattan, the first two because they outgrew their previous locations and the third because it wanted to be more than just a Miami shop with a catalog. ''One-third of our customers are in the New York, New Jersey, Connecticut area,'' said Amy Crain, near left, the owner of Room. Last week, her new 2,500-square-foot store, designed by S. Russell Groves, a Manhattan architect, opened at 182 Duane Street (Hudson Street). She designed the cream-colored Sophie sofa at rear ($3,400, plus fabric).

On July 5, Interieurs moved its bold dark-wood furniture, along with Asian and French antiques, from 114 Wooster Street to 149-151 Franklin Street (Hudson Street). Laurence Kriegel, far left, is a partner in the shop with Francine Gardner. Behind her is the Amber bed of bamboo veneer and maple, with an oak headboard ($8,320). The bed was designed by Ms. Kriegel and Dominic Gasparoli, a Belgian interior designer. The 19th-century carved Chinese wood masks, top left, sell for $2,900 apiece at Interieurs.

Waterworks is a chain of 28 stores that promote the bathroom as a complete environment. Its two Manhattan stores were not large enough, so a 7,500-square-foot shop is to open today at 225 East 57th Street, replacing a smaller showroom. The stores offer the complete bathroom -- from, at left, towels ($44) to tubs ($3,500).
